intro: Cyclobalanopsis sichourensis, commonly known as the Sichouren ironwood, is a rare and ancient tree species native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Cyclobalanopsis. It thrives in mountainous regions with acidic soils and is often found in humid, subtropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
